title.narrative: 3.4 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: A strengthened enabling environment and accountability structure within line ministries exists to support Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) at all levels, including the delivery of adequate, equitable and affordable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, increased numbers of people, especially girls and women, socially excluded groups and others in vulnerable situations, are healthy and live in resilient communities, access affordable and equitable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services and abandon open defecation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: A strengthened enabling environment and accountability structure within line ministries exists to support WASH at all levels,including the delivery of adequate, equitable and affordable WASH services.

description.narrative: Government-led WASH Sector coordination, monitoring and supervision is now active in Somaliland, Puntland and the South-Central regions, and NGO partners have been instrumental in supporting this.;UNICEF supported the development of the “National Water Resource Strategic Plan”, with UNDP under MoEWR, and the Prime Minister’s Office. UNICEF also supported the MoH on the translation of CLTS protocol and training manuals.;A UNICEF supported, Somalia Policy, strategic plan and M&E framework developed and submitted for Cabinet which is now awaiting approval is expected to bolster the foundations for sustained and inclusive improvement of WASH services in Somalia. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:31/12/2020

title.narrative: National strategy to eliminate open defecation available with a systemic approach to gender

baseline.value: Existing protocols and decree issued by line ministries at subnational strategies

target.value: 2020:National strategy to eliminate open defecation available and implemented

actual.value: 2020:At Federal Level and Puntland, the ODF roadmap is being developed with MoH but the National road map delayed

title.narrative: Existence of functioning sector coordination mechanism for water, sanitation and hygiene

target.value: 2020:Sector/cluster coordination mechanism operational under Government leadership

actual.value: 2020:WASH cluster coordination is supported as well as monitoring and supervision including response to COVID-19 pandemic

title.narrative: Existence and implementation of national water, sanitation and hygiene sector policy and strategy

target.value: 2020:Existing Sector policy and strategy funded and implemented informed by evidence; clear role and responsible of lead sector ministries, accountability mechanism exist, and innovation and initiatives to reduce disparities promoted

actual.value: 2020:Policy, strategic plan and M&E framework developed and submitted for Cabinet approval

title.narrative: National monitoring systems reporting on equity of access to WASH services available(51577)

target.value: 2020:National systems integrated with FSNAU, SWALIM and REACH regular assessments and reporting mechanisms available

actual.value: 2020:Due to covid-19 restrictions the planned consultant for this support was not engaged and the funding reprogrammed to covid-19 response
